result.execSummary:
The defendant George J Zimmerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. George J Zimmerman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • George J Zimmerman was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (>1000-2500g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Any prescription to be cleared by agent.    Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
May not have contact with felons or drug dealers, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George J Zimmerman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Discharge - Early on 7-25-17
Discharge - Early on 7-25-17
On petition for early discharge from probation; granted.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DOC Agt Erin Angel appeared by phone.  Petition for early discharge from probation.  Court grants petition.
Hearing on July 25, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Recommendation from DOC Agt Erin Angel for early discharge from probation.
Ct. 1
Cts 2 & 3
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by phone.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court gives deft firearms warning.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Oliver.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Statement from:  Bob C.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions; 1 year conditional jail w/Huber privileges is stayed.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Oliver.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  Firearms warning given.  SEH 11/24/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Oliver.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Any motions to be filed by 9/8/15; MH set for 9/23/15 at 3:30pm, JS set for 11/2/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Oliver the MH of 7/21/15 at 1:15pm is rescheduled to a STC on 8/10/15 at 1:15pm.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Oliver.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Oliver states he will be filing a motion to quash the search warrant.  MH set for 7/21/15 at 1:15pm; Atty Oliver to file motion w/n 2 weeks.  Bond continued.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Oliver.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Oliver states he just obtained information from Pleasant Prairie.  FPT continued to 6/8/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Oliver.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DA PTC 4/17/15 at 1:30pm and FPT 4/29/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

With ADA Phan and by agreement w/Atty Oliver, the FPT of 2/26/15 at 8:45am is rescheduled to 3/16/15 at 1:15pm, the DA PTC of 2/20/15 at 1:30pm is cancelled as they have agreed to another date to meet in person to discuss case.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Oliver.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DA PTC 2/20/15 at 1:30pm and FPT 2/26/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Defendant, George J Zimmerman, appeared with Attorney Phillip J. Oliver.  Attorney Jennipher Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6. Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. No Felony DA PTC scheduled as agreed by counsel; parties will meet outside of court. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:45 am.
to Preliminary Hearing

121pm
  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Phillip Oliver.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 12/9/14 @ 1030am.  Deft waives time limits.  Bond Continued.

Preliminary hearing on December 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Deft left without signing NOH.  Notice was mailed to DE
Atty Phillip Oliver
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

2:29 pm    Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk: LE.  Deft will retain his own counsel.    Initial appearance adjourned to 11-18-14 @ 1:00pm w/Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  RE: Atty status.  Time limits tolled for prelim.  Signature bond continued.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
961.41(1)(h)3 Manuf/Deliver THC, Second & Subs Offense.   /   961.41(1m)(h)3 Poss w/ Intent to Deliver THC, Second & Subs Offense   /   961.573(1) Poss of Drug Para
and witness list filed by the State

2:10 pm    Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk:  LE.    Initial appearance adjourned to 11-4-14 @ 1:00pm w/Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  $25000 signature bond set with conditions.
